## Speaker
Weiguang Cao

### Theme
Non-invertible Symmetries and SPT on Lattice

### Abstract
I will discuss noninvertible symmetries and the associated noninvertible symmetry-protected topological (NISPT) phases in lattice systems. I will begin with the simplest example, the Kramersâ€“Wannier (KW) duality symmetry, which arises from gauging a $\mathbb Z_2$ symmetry on the lattice. I will then explain how more elaborate noninvertible symmetries, such as Rep$(D_8)$, can be generated from KW via a sandwich construction. These new symmetries naturally give rise to new quantum phases of matter. Using a duality-based method, I will show how to classify NISPTs and realize them explicitly in lattice models. The resulting constructions provide concrete platforms that can be probed numerically and, potentially, in future experiments.
